data.title: Deadmau5 Releases New EP 'some ep' and Announces Tour Dates
data.meta_description: The four-track EP from Deadmau5 releases polished versions from his personal archives. Tour dates for 'day of the deadmau5' unveiled
data.text:
Electronic music maestro deadmau5 releases his new EP and has once again captivated his global audience. His latest EP, some ep, dropped today, July 19, on his label mau5trap.

This four-track collection features carefully curated selections from deadmau5’s personal archives, offering fans a polished taste of his unique sound.

Deadmau5 Releases New EP Showcasing Hidden Gems

In the midst of an extensive world tour, spanning from Bali to Helsinki, and while constructing a new music studio for his forthcoming artist album, Deadmau5 has managed to assemble these hidden gems, giving them new life for his dedicated fans. As Deadmau5 releases these new EP tracks, fans are treated to a polished taste of his unique sound.

The EP’s release coincides with the announcement of his highly anticipated ‘day of the deadmau5’ seasonal shows, set to take place in Chicago, Mexico City, Washington D.C., and for the first time, Puerto Rico, this October. Tickets are on sale now.

He will also perform at the legendary Tomorowland Belgium Weekend on July 20 as as Rezzmau5 (with REZZ).

Deadmau5 New EP ‘some ep’: Track Highlights from the Release

some ep kicks off with “Quezacotl,” characterized by its symphonic-like chords that act as a rallying cry, leading into a surge of melodic synths that showcase deadmau5’s signature style.

This track made its debut during the sold-out ‘retro5spective: 25 years of deadmau5’ shows at the Hollywood Bowl in Los Angeles and the Brooklyn Mirage in NYC earlier this year. The EP also includes “Wet,” an epic techno production from deadmau5’s alter ego TESTPILOT.

This track, marking TESTPILOT’s first studio production since 2014, takes listeners on a dark, pulsating journey through complex synth patterns and four-on-the-floor beats.

The collection is rounded out by “Sever” and “Input Output,” both of which further exemplify deadmau5’s versatility and production prowess. “Input Output” also premiered at the Brooklyn Mirage during the ‘retro5spective’ show.

Experience ‘day of the deadmau5’ Live Shows

Known for their unique and immersive experiences, the ‘day of the deadmau5’ shows are a fan favorite, featuring everything from iconic tracks like “Ghosts ‘n’ Stuff” and “Strobe” to the latest material from some ep.

These shows promise a blend of state-of-the-art production, visuals with a spooky flair, and an invitation for fans to come in costume, showcasing their custom-made mau5heads.

For 2024, attendees can expect both deadmau5 and TESTPILOT sets, with a varied lineup of mau5trap artists and friends adding to the Halloween festivities.

As Deadmau5 releases his new EP, the excitement for these events only intensifies, promising an unforgettable experience for all who attend.

Tracklist for some ep:

“Quezacotl”

“Wet” (as TESTPILOT)

“Sever”

“Input Output”

Listen to deadmau5’s some ep here.

Upcoming ‘day of the deadmau5’ Shows:

*Indicates ‘day of the deadmau5’ shows.

October 12 – Washington D.C. – Echo Stage*

October 25 – Las Vegas, NV – Zouk

November 1 – Morrison, CO – Red Rocks

November 2 – Morrison, CO – Red Rocks

Tickets for all dates are available now. Don’t miss the chance to experience deadmau5 live and immerse yourself in the latest chapter of his illustrious career.
